subject: Tennis
Olympic Games (2008)
lead_paragraph: Andy Roddick, the highest-ranked American player, will skip the Beijing Olympics, choosing instead to focus on preparing for the United States Open by playing in Washington at the hard-court Legg Mason Tennis Classic, which runs Aug. 11-17, the same dates as the Olympic tennis event. The United States Open begins Aug. 25.“My goal every summer is to win the U.S. Open,” Roddick said Wednesday in a statement released by Legg Mason organizers. “I have won the Legg Mason Tennis Classic three times and feel defending my title in Washington best prepares me for another Grand Slam title.”.
